New in and children's reading ideas

Subscribe to our monthly newsletter for reading, viewing and listening suggestions straight to your inbox.

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 3, 2017

Today's book is Dr. Tenth: Christmas Surprise!, by Roger Hargreaves.

The Twelve Days of Christmas, by Britta Teckentrup

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 2, 2017

Today's book is The Twelve Days of Christmas, by Britta Teckentrup.

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 1, 2017

Today's book is The 12 Days of Christmas, by Pilgrim Lee.

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 30, 2017

Stock librarian Sophie picks out her favourite children's books of 2017

Check out a Blue Peter Book Awards nominee

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 24, 2017

The shortlist for the 2018 Blue Peter Book Awards has been announced. Reserve a fiction or non-fiction nominee today.

Learn something new in National Non-Fiction November with these shortlists

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 22, 2017

If your child wants to nurture a particular interest, or prefers non-fiction to fiction, why not reserve a book from the Royal Society Young People's Book Prize or School Library Association Information Book Award shortlists?

Borrow an exceptional book from the Costa Children's Book Award shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 22, 2017

The shortlist for the 2017 Costa Children's Book Award has been announced. Why not reserve one of these highly-recommended books?

Recommended new audiobooks for children #2

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 2, 2017

We've picked out the best new CD and digital audiobooks for children.

New children's books for November 2017

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 30, 2017

New titles for fans of Asterix, Batman, Diary of a Wimpy Kid and much more.

Mark Halloween with these spooky books for children

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 24, 2017

Witches, monsters and skeletons abound in our delightfully creepy Halloween list for under-11s.
